body:
This error doesn't appear when trying to use a template class with a function pointer type, only template functions. Tested on Cython 0.24 and current 0.25a master branch.

Example code:

```cython
cdef extern from *:
    void my_function[T]()

my_function[int(int, int)]()
```

Error:

```
Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
cdef extern from *:
    void my_function[T]()

my_function[int(int, int)]()              ^
------------------------------------------------------------

test.pyx:4:15: not parsable as a type

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
cdef extern from *:
    void my_function[T]()

my_function[int(int, int)]()          ^
------------------------------------------------------------

test.pyx:4:11: Compiler crash in AnalyseExpressionsTransform

File 'Nodes.py', line 429, in analyse_expressions: StatListNode(test.pyx:1:0)
File 'Nodes.py', line 4748, in analyse_expressions: ExprStatNode(test.pyx:4:26)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 519, in analyse_expressions: SimpleCallNode(test.pyx:4:26,
    analysed = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 5079, in analyse_types: SimpleCallNode(test.pyx:4:26,
    analysed = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 3383, in analyse_types: IndexNode(test.pyx:4:11,
    is_called = 1,
    is_subscript = True,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 3453, in analyse_base_and_index_types: IndexNode(test.pyx:4:11,
    is_called = 1,
    is_subscript = True,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 3554, in analyse_as_c_function: IndexNode(test.pyx:4:11,
    is_called = 1,
    is_subscript = True,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)

Compiler crash traceback from this point on:
  File "{trimmed}/site-packages/Cython-0.25a0-py3.5.egg/Cython/Compiler/ExprNodes.py", line 3554, in analyse_as_c_function
    elif len(base_type.templates) != len(self.type_indices):
TypeError: object of type 'NoneType' has no len()
```
title: Compiler crash when attempting to use function pointer type as template function argument
